cluster_relations.rel_desc: Authorities are described as using repression against protests and revolutions.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: seeking to maintain their grip on power

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Authorities are described as using violence against protests and revolutions.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: seeking to maintain their grip on power

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The crackdown in Belarus specifically targets pro-democracy protesters.
cluster_relations.subject_entity_name: crackdown on pro-democracy protesters in Belarus

args.canonical_rel_desc: Actor employs or uses a coercive or repressive measure as a method of control.
args.justification: Both relations describe authorities employing specific coercive control measures (repression, violence) as tools to maintain power; they share identical predicate semantics (actor uses a coercive method).
These relations connect state authorities to the specific coercive methods they deploy, fitting a class focused on methods of state coercion and control.
Semantically, the link is that authorities make use of certain coercive measures; this is best captured as a usage/means relation (actor uses tool/method).

args.canonical_rel_desc: A repressive or coercive action or campaign is directed against a specific group or actor as its target.
args.justification: The relation states that the crackdown is specifically directed at pro-democracy protesters; the core predicate is that the crackdown targets this group.
This relation links a repression event (crackdown) to the group it is aimed at, fitting a class for targets or victims of repression actions.
The semantics involve an intentional action (crackdown) directed by an agent against a target group, which aligns with an agency/actor-action-target dimension.

Semantically, the link is that authorities make use of certain coercive measures; this is best captured as a usage/means relation (actor uses tool/method).

The semantics involve an intentional action (crackdown) directed by an agent against a target group, which aligns with an agency/actor-action-target dimension.
